trends: There have been 35 other sightings in Kingman
There were no other sightings in Kingman on or around October 26th 2001
divs: Sighting DetailsAfter my first observation on the previous night, I have spent more time looking skyward to see if I can identify another ���moving star.��� At the noted time, I saw a small red star begin to move and travel a few degrees Eastward. It then curved slightly to the South for several degrees before returning to its original Eastward direction. It then stopped abruptly and did not move again. This star was fairly dim and not very noticeable. Total travel was around 10 degrees. It was nearly directly overhead and looked like any other normal star before during and after movement. I went inside to warm up and returned outside for a check on the stars position. Being as the star was so dim, I could no longer find it among the other stars, so its location was now uncertain. At this point I checked the green Southern star that I had seen move the previous night. It appeared in its normal position and had tracked through its normal range of movement, at least as far as I could tell.
Summary: Small red star moved in non star like manner.
